name: Growth Hacking
body: This is the Sample project of a *Growth Hacking* process at Exemplary Samples Co.

tasks.name: **Growth Hack Idea Template**
tasks.body:
LABELS:

  • Goal: (Awareness, Activation, Acquisition, Retention, Referral, Revenue, Operations) - GREEN Label
  • Focus is on: (Blog, Website, SEO, Social, Customers, Media Buying) - BLUE Label
  • By using: (Content, Copy, CRO, Referral, SEM, SEO, Social, UI, UX, CSM, Automation, Email) - RED Label
  • KPI: (Blog Sessions, Blog Sign ups, Trial Sign ups, Google Organic, traffic, Referral Traffic, Weekly Active Users (WAU), Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR), Churn, Session Duration, Pages Per Session) - YELLOW Label

comments.body: Leroy the Marketing Manager This seems like an idea that needs to be tested ASAP. Focus on it first, please.

comments.body: Here is the template of the mail I would like to use.

tasks.body:

  • Goal: Acquisition

  • By using: Content

comments.body: This is what PDF should look like:

tasks.name: "Was this post useful?" on Blog (5/3)
tasks.body:
LABELS:

  • Goal: Operations
  • Focus is on: Blog
  • By using: UI, UX
  • KPI: Blog Sessions, Blog Sign ups, Session Duration

tasks.name: Send ebooks during user onboarding (4/5)
tasks.body:
LABELS:

  • Goal: Retention
  • Focus is on: Customers
  • By using: Email
  • KPI: Churn

comments.body: It turns out our e-books provide excellent input for new users. Our churn decreased by 3% since we started with this tactics.

tasks.name: Remove post date and shorten URL (4/3)
tasks.body:
LABELS:

  • Goal: Awareness
  • Focus is on: Blog
  • By using: SEO
  • KPI: Blog Sessions

comments.body: It turns out Google prefers shorter URLs. We've moved up by 5 positions for specific keywords just by implementing this simple change.

tasks.name: Place GIF of a product on homepage (4/3)
tasks.body:
HYPOTHESIS: Higher engagement when animated.


Ease: (1=hard, 5=easy)

Impact: (1=low, 5 = high)

 

LABELS:

  • Goal: Activation
  • Focus is on: Website
  • By using: Content
  • KPI: Trial Sign ups

comments.body: Time on page increased. Also we increased number of trials by 2.5% within 14 days.

tasks.name: Realign social buttons to the left side of the screen (5/3)

comments.body:
Change made no difference in number of shares or clicks on the social buttons. Neither did it improve time on page.

Moving the task into a "Loser" column.

tasks.name: If a new user purchases our product within the first week of the trial, they get a discount (2/5)

comments.body: Blocked! Waiting for an approval from upper management.

discussions.name: Dissecting Growth Hack ideas
discussions.body: As the title suggests, this is discussion is meant for current and potential idea analysis. If you have any questions about any growth idea, this is the place to ask.

notes.name: Rules of Growth Hacking project
notes.body:
Title of the task: Growth Hack idea explained in one sentence 

Within the task description:
  • Provide the Hypothesis
  • Determine idea's difficulty (1=hard, 5=easy)
  • Determine idea's impact on business (1=low, 5=high)
Determine and LABEL:
  • Goal: (Awareness, Activation, Acquisition, Retention, Referral, Revenue, Operations)
  • Focus on: (Blog, Website, SEO, Social, Customers, Media Buying)
  • Tool: (Content, Copy, CRO, Referral, SEM, SEO, Social, UI, UX, CSM, Automation, Email)
  • KPIs: (Blog Sessions, Blog Sign ups, Trial Signups, Google organic traffic, Referral Traffic, Weekly Active Users (WAU), Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR), Churn, Session Duration, Pages per Session)
  • Start and due date
